Reviews.Title: “OK if you're deaf!”
Reviews.Author: ShingleSpringsGuy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and comfortable, the free breakfast OK but uninspiring. But the noise from the all-night freight trains across the street is a killer. The little envelope with complimentary ear plugs should have been my warning. But I didn't put 2 and 2 together until I was just drifting off to sleep after a long day of travel. I nearly hit the ceiling when the first train whistle blew! For the rest of the night, about every couple hours, the loud train whistles and rumbles jolted me out of a sound sleep. The tracks are right across the street behind the commercial buildings on Poplar. OMG there's no way I'll stay here again. Sorry Hampton but you really should warn people about this.

Reviews.Title: “A night of no sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Cathie C
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of Hampton Inns but this was an awful experience. I was in Memphis with my daughter and granddaughter to visit Rhodes College. We selected this hotel for its easy access to the campus. Our room was very small compared to other Hampton properties and the two beds were double beds...the first time I have encountered double beds...usually when requesting a room with two beds we get queeen beds. However, we were prepared to deal with that situation. What we were not prepared for was the noise from trains that woke us three times during the night. We got very little uninterrupted sleep as each train blew horns that made it sound as if they were right outside our window! We discovered the next morning that the train tracks/crossing are one block over from the hotel. I do not recommend this property to anyone needing a good night's sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, great Breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: R-Margaret
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to attend the tennis tournaments at the Morgan Keegan Racquet Club and everything was as good as I would expect and to meet famous tennis players staying there also, was a hugh plus ! Service was great and the only thing that could be improved upon is to have maids that speak English. The ones I tried to deal with could NOT ! It was impossible to communicate unless you played charades ! Not fun at all ! They also knock on your doors early to see if you are checking out ! ! ! Yet can't answer a question !

Reviews.Title: “Hot Coffee & Cold Elevators!”
Reviews.Author: SusanCBM
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hampton on Poplar and on the whole, found it a fair place to stay in Memphis. We chose the Hampton due to it's location. The room was of average size, I like the little desk area. Bathroom was nice with lots of towels. Our room was clean and the bed was comfortable with lots of pillows. For some reason - the elevators were very cold. But the coffee was hot - I do love it that they have hot coffee and tea available 24 hours. Very convenient to be able to grab some coffee or tea at any time. On the whole - I would stay at the Hampton on Poplar again - didn't have breakfast there but it looked like it would be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to usual Hampton Inn standards”
Reviews.Author: Wlonadier
Reviews.Content: Small rooms. Short of outlets. Small bathroom. Comes with complimentary ear plugs. Enough said? trains come by often and loudly throughout the night.

Reviews.Title: “BarBQue and Waffles”
Reviews.Author: boards_s
Reviews.Content: This Hampton has a free full breakfast, with make your own waffles, hot oatmeal, eggs, sausage, juice, coffee, and much more. Our family gathered in the lobby area in the evening where there were plenty of chairs and tables. We chose the location because it is across the street from Corky's BarBQue and close to all our destinations, but you can hear the train all night long. Beds are comfortable. Supposedly new decor, but our room was run down and very sparse with no place to put anything.

Reviews.Title: “As the British Would Say "Frightfully Delightful!"”
Reviews.Author: HungryDave1
Reviews.Content: I went to Memphis for a church conference and I stayed at this hotel that we nearby. It was really pleasant and comfortable. The decor was new and my room was clean. Anytime I asked the front desk for a recommendation for a nearby place to eat, they always had some good suggestions. There are 2 really great BBQ places kitty corner from the Hampton. I went walking in the neighborhood (behind the hotel) cause I need some excercise and it was really lovely. Poplar street is really great cause there all types of stores there. Great location. I honestly don't have anything negative to say. All around this Hampton was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: Nancy M
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful Hampton Inn with very clean and comfortable rooms. However, I did have to give it a poor rating as far as location is concerned. There is a railroad a block or less away that runs all night. We would stay here again but would try to get a run on the back portion of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, hoping to come back”
Reviews.Author: JonDCllns
Reviews.Content: I read some of the negative comments on here before booking my weekend trip to Memphis. But I have to say that this is a great hotel. Place is clean and staff is friendly. I saw comments on here about the train noise, so I requested a room on the back side of the hotel...I think we heard the train maybe twice while here and that was only during the day. I will say that the ac unit is pretty loud. Didn't bother my wife and I, but if you are a very light sleeper it may bother you. This is your average Hampton Inn. Nothing fancy, but it's comfortable and a good value. If you want to pay $200/per night to stay downtown and have mints on your pillows than go for it...but this place is a quick 15 minute drive from downtown and WAY cheaper. Save your money for all the cool stuff you can do downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Super convenient, clean and a good value.”
Reviews.Author: BCIcan
Reviews.Content: I was in town on business. The hotel was located within 2 blocks of my office building, so it was very convienent. There are some great restaurants nearby, especially Buckley's Steakhouse just a block away. About 15 minutes from downtown memphis, this hotel is a great location. The only downside could be the train tracks across the street. I was on the back side of the building, so I never heard the trains. I wouldn't hesitate to go back. The only disappointment was how small the "fitness center" was.

Reviews.Title: “Memphis Weekedn in the Summer”
Reviews.Author: Tndale
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hampton Inn on Poplar this past weekend. Even though the hotel was full with guests for weddings, family reunions and those on vacation, we found our accomodations very satisfactory and were attended to at every need by a willing staff. My wife and I even had a chance to visit for a few moments with the Manager David at breakfast Saturday AM, he was engaging and kind. The room was clean and comfortable, however the only concern was the lack of storage or drawers in the room. The closet was certainly large enough to hang coats, shirts, pants and so forth but there was little other space for socks, underwear, t-shirts, etc. Storage space aside, the beds were very comfortable, pillows fluffy and the comforter kept us warm while we ran the a/c cool during the night!! I was pleased that the full house did not translate into noisey neighbors or wild ones running the hallways. Breakfast Saturday and Sunday morning was satisfying and a good value. Coffee (regular, decaf and robust) is hot and fresh with a chioce of cream or coffe mate creamers. I knew if the coffee was good, everything else would be fine! One can choose from a variety of breads (toast, bagels, english muffins, muffins, pastries), cereals, waffles, eggs and bacon, fresh fruit, yogurt and juices. My wife says the Cranberry Juice was the BEST she has tasted! Overall a wonderful stay for our weekend in Memphis. This location is convenient to Germantown, Midtown and a straight shot to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: boomer2s
Reviews.Content: Was surprised to find that this hotel is in a great location. Very close to many great restaurants. Whether you are in the mood for american, itallian, mexican, or BBQ (Original Corky's right across the street) this is the place. Rooms are a little small but adequate. Service is outstanding and the free breakfast is right on the mark. Pool is small but uncrowded. As stated in some of the other reviews, the train is for real. Numerous times during the night I woke to hear the train passing. Not the fault of the hotel staff but is is a reality and should be considered. Overall a great place and I will definately be back. Oh, and GREAT VALUE! Price is very reasonable and definately worth the cost!!!

Reviews.Title: “Still a good option”
Reviews.Author: rainey1
Reviews.Content: I have family in Memphis, so we go often and I've seen just about every option the city has to offer as far as accommodations go. In 2008, this Hampton Inn became my home away from home because of the wonderful service, the exceptional beds and the better than average breakfast. I cannot say enough good about this particular hotel. The only negative I have to say is that if you are traveling with children and require a queen size bed, then you might have a problem. The beds are doubles. They are still very comfortable, however. You can get a King study room if you have small children, which includes a king-sized bed and a small pull-out sofa bed, but this option will only work if your children are small enough. It was because our children started growing up that we finally had to find another home away from home. Please see my other reviews for other Hilton Brand options in Memphis for people with larger sized family members.

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: MsMfs
Reviews.Content: nice clean, well located hotel with complimentary breakfast and waffles. a real hit!

Reviews.Title: “Another Nice Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: Hortkie
Reviews.Content: Nice Hampton, nice rooms, the biz center is sort of lacking - just a monitor next to front desk, the hallways were super hot and uncomfortbale - not sure if this was a problem with A/ C or with a mngmnt choice to not turn it on in hallways - come on, this is Memphis and it's HOT. Turn on the d..m air in the hallway...I thik i'll take one start off for that. Good area with good places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't have to stay downtown, this is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DiR46
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this Hampton Inn. We received a very friendly greeting from Ashley and pleased to see there was hot tea and coffee and cookies available in the lobby. After a long drive, this is what we felt like. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. I did hear a couple of trains during the night, but not enough to bother me. The air conditioning though did seem to ratttle every now and then which was more of a bother. The car park is very well lit at night. There was no refrigerator but there was an efficient ice machine. The friendly staff, comfortable rooms and substantial breakfast make this a very good place to stay. It was across the road from Corky's where we ate dinner and also from some fast food places.

Reviews.Title: “The doors don't lock!”
Reviews.Author: PabloCasals
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on April 20-21 and loved it! The price was great too! The neighborhood is really nice and the hotel is very clean and modern. The staff was so helpful and friendly. However, I noticed that the doors seemed to close and catch, but when you looked closer and opened them they were not completely closed and were NOT locked. So when I opened the door in the morning, I discovered that it had not been locked all night. I didn't think too much about it, and we stayed at the same hotel a week later on our way home. The next morning we had to get up at about 5:30 to leave, and I heard screaming next door, and didn't think much about it. I just figured it was kids having fun, but I heard, "HELP! HELP! Get OUT, get OUT!" in the hall, I opened the door and saw two middle aged ladies in nightclothes screaming. My husband went out in the hall too and when we asked what was the matter, they said a man in his boxers had come into their room when they were sleeping. When they woke up and screamed for him to get out, he wouldn't, he just walked to the window and told them to, "Shut the F*** up!" He didn't leave until they ran out of the room and we came into the hall. I immediately went to the phone and pressed zero and got the desk. I thought she would call the police like I asked her to, but she came upstairs. When I got off the phone and got towels for the ladies, since they were in their nightgowns, they were standing behind my husband in the hall and talking a mile a minute. My husband said the man had come out of the room and when into a room across the hall. When the front desk lady knocked and he answered he denied having been in the ladies room, but my husband and the ladies both said he was the one. He came out into the hall in his underwear and appeared to be under the influence of something. I felt so sorry for those two ladies to be further abused by this bad man on top of being scared to death and who knows what else. I felt like the front desk lady did a really good job of not letting the situation get further out of control, but she should have phoned the police! I hope those two ladies did. She was really nice to us when I stopped at the desk later and chatted with her about it. I would stay at this hotel again, just make DOUBLY sure the door is all of the way closed and locked.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay in a wedding block”
Reviews.Author: dda0002
Reviews.Content: Can't speak for anyone else in the group though. We stayed one night after the wedding. The hotel had one of the meeting rooms set up that we could use that as a party/group room. I did feel bad for the guest rooms that were just past reception with a loud group room right next to them. Hotel has a good location right on Poplar. Accessible to 240 easily as well to Midtown Memphis and the eastern suburbs. Our room was very clean, no issues at all with that. The bathroom has a bit of an odd layout that the towels are under the sink, so that either required preplanning to get a towel or stepping out of the shower and across the bathroom to get a towel. Breakfast was a standard, decent Hampton breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: dolittledigger
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a new nights driving down from Detroit in August. GREAT location! And the breakfast was great. Just what you need to start the day. Typical cereals, bagels/donuts, juices, a hot item which was bisquits and gravy and scrambled eggs. Just lots of choices. Rooms were very nice. Walking distance to everything. Parking attached to hotel with a price per night, but we didn't care. When you travel, you have to know about these things. We paid about $125 a night if I recall. We toured Graceland of course, ate at The Pig??? On Beale Street. Loved my pulled pork nachos. We were told by a few locals not to eat at Rendevouz-not sure if that is spelled right. Gibson Guitar Factory tour was kind of neat. Overall, great experience for a few days. No problems to write about

Reviews.Title: “Average, expected better...”
Reviews.Author: barkus1968
Reviews.Content: This Hampton Inn is cramped. Small rooms, small dining room for breakfast and awkward area for the breakfast bar. Our air conditioning unit didn't work well leading to a humid stay. I liked the location and the grounds are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms a little small, train across street, but overall fine.”
Reviews.Author: Bama001
Reviews.Content: If we had known about the train we probly wouldn't have booked, but I only heard it once after 10 pm. Overall it was fine and lived up to Hampton standards. Wouldn't rec only because of train noise risk and there are other Hamptons not far away that are quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: colette424
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and comfortable. The hotel was quiet. Breakfast was your basic continental. There isn't really much to say about the hotel. Nothing stood out. I would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “I hope you like train horns...”
Reviews.Author: hoyajess
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was clean and comfortable, but I was awakened every half hour or so by prolonged train horns only a few hundred feet away. When we asked to switch rooms to the other side of the hotel, the staff was a bit resistent, and it turns out you can hear the trains from there too. The closets were also incredibly small and couldn't even hold my travel suitcase. There was only one accesible wall outlet that was on the opposite side of the room from my bed, which wasn't helpful for charging my phone at night.

Reviews.Title: “My money was stollen.”
Reviews.Author: TLCAR
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on New Years Eve. I left my purse in the room when I went out so I wouldn't lose my money. When I returned to the room my money was missing. The manager checked the key rings on the computer but it was not working, and said he couldn't do anything about it. Someone working there had to have stolen my money. He didn't offer any compensation, just said I should call the police. I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveler007
Reviews.Content: Check in was fine. When I opened the door to the room, I was greeted with a chlorine like smell that wasn't coming from the bathroom. The room looked clean enough, but that smell kind of ruined it. Both key cards issued to us stopped working after we used them once. It took 2 trips to the front desk to get cards that worked. Finally, my wife saw a flea in the bathroom and in the bed. I will not be staying here on my next stop in Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “Tired but clean, good value and central location”
Reviews.Author: nwark
Reviews.Content: 2 adults, one teen (on college search trip) in king suite. Would consider this very basic, small, tired decor but clean accommodations. Room is tight w/ sofa bed in use. Small bathroom w/ shower only but plenty of hot water and clean towels. Check in and out was friendly and quick. Breakfast standard fare, well stocked and clean. Excellent, safe feeling location near interstate loop and between downtown and Germantown, at 5320 Poplar Ave., Memphis, TN. Be aware: a train track is literally across the street along Poplar and you may very well hear a train pass at least once during the night. Don't think it bothered my husband or daughter but I heard it. This hotel is a value and it served our purpose for this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lilun2005
Reviews.Content: I thought that the hotel staff was friendly, the room was clean, and I was very comfortable for the entire weekend. I had a very enjoyable stay. The room was very updated, however it was somewhat small. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: soozn98
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with the overall quality of the hotel. It was a decent price for a decent hotel. Nothing too exciting, but good.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and I'm picky”
Reviews.Author: thisisgettingold
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent one night here for a visit to Rhodes College. We thought it was very nice. Clean, quiet, comfortable. There was nothing "icky" about it to us and we are particular. Beds were very soft. People who want a firm mattress might not care for that. We had multiple pillows on our beds with varying degrees of firmness. I will definitely stay here again. Staff was very nice. I thought I had something leaking from my car (duh, turned out to be water from the a/c) and the fellow at the front desk looked up the dealership closest to us. The breakfast was nothing special. Cereal, toast, biscuits and pastries were fine. Eggs left much to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, a little icky”
Reviews.Author: virgenia1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night during Memorial Day weekend. Older Hampton that has been updated, but still needs work. It just felt dingy and dirty--to the point where I put a towel down on the sofa before sitting on it. The sofa itself needed to be replaced--caved in when I sat on it. Room was smaller than usual and we missed having a refrigerator and microwave. Two of the three icemakers in the hotel were broken. No TV listing in the room. I wrote a long review of the hotel for TriPAdvisor and the internet went out before it posted and I lost it. This is the replacement. Breakfast was good as usual and there are restaurants within walking distance. Bennigans is right next door and Corky's BBQ (rated #4 restaurant in Memphis) is across the street and down one block. Don't even think about driving--there is space for about 6 cars. The line of cars for the drive thru carryout stretched out onto Poplar Ave. So it is very busy and crowded. We went to Neely's instead--about 8 minutes away. Graceland is an easy 15 minute drive. All in all, probably one of the shabbier Hamptons we have styed at.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, good value”
Reviews.Author: southaustin
Reviews.Content: This is one of the better Hamptons that we've stayed in. The place was very quiet and reasonably close in to downtown Memphis. The price was right and since we were heading east it was easy to head outbound in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “I WOULD NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN. I WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE.”
Reviews.Author: lifeisgood114
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is fine, but the staff make it a nightmare to stay there. We went for Memphis in May MusicFest and in our rush out on Friday night, forgot to close the door to our room all the way. It closed behind us but didn't lock shut, when we got back we discovered that one of the guy's bags with his laptop was missing. They couldn't have been less helpful, blamed us for the loss, including telling Memphis PD that we "left the door wide open with the laptop just laying out." They also don't allow walking around the hotel at night, and accused us of having an underage drinking party in our room, simply because we're 3 college kids in town for music. I WOULD NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Can always count on Hampton Inn having comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: MimiTennessee
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were in Memphis for a weekend get away. We chose this Hampton because of its location. The staff,..especially Arlene, were extremely nice. The room were very clean and the beds sooo comfortable. This is always a 'big plus' for me, and one of the reasons I choose a Hampton Inn for most of my stays. Thanks HAMPTON!! cg Martin, TN

Reviews.Title: “As expected from a Hampton”
Reviews.Author: amstevan
Reviews.Content: Good location. Clean room. Good price. Breakfast as advertised. Down side. Had trouble understanding moring desk clerk. Morning breakfast lady touched frozen eggs with bare hands. Of course after cooking all germs gone. Having said this I would stay here again if in area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: liplord
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews for our last night of a driving tour on the way back to Nashville Airport. It was a good choice. There were many business people in the hotel and the rooms are clean, quiet and well-equipped. I did hear the train once in the night but it was not a major inconvenience. Our request for a room on the top floor at the back of the hotel was honoured. Breakfast was quiet when we ate and well stocked with a variety of food. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is close to the Botanical Garden, Brooks Gallery and the I-240 and Corky's BBQ is just down the street. If you aren't staying downtown, this is a very good choice in Memphis. The price was very reasonable compared with many other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Predictable Hampton”
Reviews.Author: kctraveler99
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults and a 8 year old enjoyed the Poplar Hampton, We were passing though on way to Rosemary Beach, FL (near Panama City). Hotel easy to find, and lots of ample parking. Check in was speedy and efficient. typical small outdoor pool, but OK since it was not crowded. They have new 32inch flat panel LCD tv's and the breakfast buffet was good. We enjoyed dinner at Corky's BBQ across the street from the hotel. Hotel in anice area of town, and overall a good and predicatble Hampton Experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly”
Reviews.Author: GermanyTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent example of the Hampton qualities. Friendly service trying to anticipate your needs, and clean, comfortable, quiet rooms. They are a little on the small side, but well taken care of. The breakfast area can get a little crowded.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rainey1
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. I have family in Memphis, and each time I return to visit I've found it increasingly difficult to find reasonable lodging in a safe part of town for a reasonable price. I've stayed in all types of chains all over town and have paid money in several different price ranges. To me this hotel, while definitely not the least expensive, was the best value I've foud for the money, and just happens to be centrally located enough to be convenient to almost everything. The room was spectacular (the beds are the best). It was very clean and comfortable. I didn't hear the train even without earplugs. Nice pool for the kids. The carpets were worn in the halls, but the room carpeting wasn't (nor was it dirty). I think this is my new home away from home while in Memphis!

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Me9247
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of times while on business in Memphis. Nice location, clean, friendly staff and nice breakfast. My only complaint is the train but that is not the hotel's issue. For those that do not know a train goes up and down Poplar. This hotel is on the other side of Poplar. I bring ear plugs and there is no issue. Very clean and great bed. So that trump the train. Single woman business travel and feel safe.

Reviews.Title: “Aging but Adequate”
Reviews.Author: monkeylizard
Reviews.Content: It's the average Hampton Inn with some worn areas. It's time for new carpets and wall coverings, but the room was well furnished and seemed clean. I had booked a King, but was given a queen instead. Something about a problem with the remaining King rooms. Not a big deal. I was offered a free in-room movie for the change but didn't use it. Memphis is muggy in the summer, even with a drought. Steam from the shower set off the smoke detector. It went off again at 1:30 am. I had to keep the A/C on the "Only penguins like it this cold" setting to keep the detector silent. When I mentioned this to th morning manager, I received no response at all. Breakfast was the typical Hampton Inn breakfast. Lots of bagels, doughnuts, muffins, yogurt, cereal and fruit. It was difficult finding a place to sit. The hotel was pretty full and the breakfast/lobby area is not very large. All in all, the hotel served the purpose of an overnight stay, but I wouldn't want to be there any longer and probably won't go back, mostly because of the smoke detector. We had friends staying at the Hampton Inn at the Wolfchase Galleria who enjoyed their stay. Next time I'm in Memphis, I'll be staying there. More restaurants/shopping and a newer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Helpful staff.........”
Reviews.Author: mufcfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 16/5/07 to 20/5/07. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was good with a very comfortable bed. Good complimentary breakfasts. Not too far to travel to Downtown by car, about 15 mins. Good eating places within walking ditance (Corkies just across the road). This was our first time visiting the USA and we were made very welcome and enjoyed our stay very much. So much that we will be returning soon. You must visit Gracelands and The Sun Studio. We also made severel trips to Beale Street where there was a wonderful atmosphere. Also recommend The Civil Rights Museum where Dr Martin Luther King was shot. In summary an excellent stay in Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Hampton”
Reviews.Author: txtraveler63
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our recent stay at the Hampton. Very friendly, courteous staff. Obvious recent renovation, nice updates. Comfy bed with wonderful pillows. Housekeeping did an outstanding job and I am very particular. The complimentary breakfast was good and offered a variety of items. Room was on the back side of the hotel, noticed very little outside noise other than an occasional train which wasn't bad. The area is nice and close to several local restaurants. Try Buckley's for a nice steak dinner and Corky's BBQ is about one block to the west. Very nice Malco theater less than a half mile to the west at Mendenhall. We honestly have no complaints only compliments. We would choose this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Effective rehab for an older Hampton”
Reviews.Author: marais
Reviews.Content: Unable to book a room at a good rate downtown for my business trip due to Memphis in May, I decided to go farther afield and stay out in East Memphis at this Hampton on Poplar. Yes, this place has been here for a while, but it has been totally updated and was pleasant to stay in. Check-in was a tad slow, the desk clerk didn't see my HHonors status so it didn't go as smoothly as it usually does at Hampton. My room was small but efficiently laid out, and the rehab included a paneled alcove near the window for a desk on casters, recessed lights and a tiny closet (adequate for one, watch out for two). Nice redo to the bathroom with all the current Hampton touches (desk vanity, new fixtures, extended shower rod, massage shower head). Free WiFi in the room, 11Mbps but flaky at times. Beds were new Hampton, a bit soft for me but if you aren't me you would love it. Comp breakfast was usual Hampton standard, and that is good. I noticed that there were stone counters in the lounge, good for solo working and eating. Housekeeping was thorough. The big downside to where I stayed had nothing to do with the hotel per se. Poplar is the main drag of Memphis, and there was abundant traffic noise, including a nearby train track with frequent trains (and frequent loud train whistles as they went through this heavily trafficked area). Ask for a room at the back of the property (believe it or not, near the elevators) if noise might be an issue for you. Otherwise, I would stay here again. BTW a Buckley's (local chain) is within walking distance for a good steak, and the Blue Plate Cafe is close to I-240 for good meat-and-three eatin' and breakfast all day with great biscuits.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!! LOVED IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: jandm2008
Reviews.Content: My mother and I went to Memphis on vacation over Easter weekend. Upon check in the first reaction we got was great. The facilities were spotless, the staff was out of this world. In fact we feel like we made some new friends!! The extensive breakfast was hot and satisfying. When we return to Memphis or anyone we know goes we will recommend for them to stay there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful! The staff was friendly, the breakfast was warm and had good protein choices. The room was clean, quiet, and very upscale. Well worth the moderate price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place to stay. The staff was curtious. The rooms were clean, and comfortable. The free extended breakfast was great. I highly recommend the Hampton Inn

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: TrvlrX
Reviews.Content: Hampton on Poplar is well located, but it is one of Hampton's earliest properties. There are other Hamptons near by that are much newer and have better amenities.

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn Memphis-Poplar
HotelInfo.Address: 5320 Poplar Ave, Memphis, TN 38119
